reviews.review_msg: Clare is a really tough but really fair prof. She is incredibly kind, willing to help her students outside of class, and really wants everyone to succeed. The workload for this class was heavy, and she moves through the materials very quickly, but her lectures are very clear and very knowledgeable. I would absolutely take another class with her!

Clare put people on the spot and could sometimes be unclear but class environment was very professional, respectful, and positive. Everyone dreaded the group project but it ended up being a lot of fun and very helpful. Quizzes were surprisingly difficult. If you care even a little bit about poli sci, she will sense it and love you.

I'm pretty sure this was Clare's first time teaching at SFU, but she was amazing! Her lectures were always very organized  with a slide on the class structure. Easy speak to and access outside of class. Very mature, fair, and helps every student feel welcome in the class! If you have the option, take a class with her! A very knowledgeable prof!

Easy marker, if you know anything about politics you'll do great. However as a professor.. oh boy. Terrible with communication, vague syllabus, incomplete responses to emails, disorganized, and monotoned. I don't care how well I did in that class I would rather chew on cardboard than have him again. He takes interesting content and makes it hell.

Lazy, inconsistent, confusing, unclear, unorganized, mono-toned, unpredictable, no communication with students, no grading criteria, changes expectations for assignments depending when you ask him about them, says he'll post slides online and then doesn't, he just reads from the slides, gets irrationally upset at people who are late, just awful.

talks very quiet and monotone.. reads off the lecture slides and does not give time for you to take the notes down before changing slides. Very boring and mentions "capacity" a lot without explanation.

Oftentimes brings up personal bias in lecture and presents a dismissive attitude towards an open minded discourse between him and students. Needs to be more open and willing to deliver culturally appropriate and sensitive materials.

Logan was a sweetheart. The textbook is only necessary to learn more about base concepts, the lectures really fill in the blanks. He tried his best to make the course material interesting, so the three hour lectures weren't stale and he gives good feedback.

Do not take as an elective. While lectures & content are interesting, Logan tends to rush through the content. Midterms & Finals were generally fair, although some questions were quite specific. Feedback on essays was extremely vague which made it difficult to improve. Class is not scaled and he marks hard, so class average hovers around a B-.

Logan was a great lecturer. His midterms and final both had very irrelevant material that most people would overlook. As for the term paper, he did not give feedback at all on how to improve. He is a tough marker and expects a lot from a first-year-level course. I took this course as an elective, and I regret it and do not recommend it.

Dr.Logan is an excellent professor! He's open to your questions and gets straight to the point with his answers. The participation marks go a long way so make sure to come to class and do the discussions. The midterms were very specific to the textbook so make sure you understand the theories and concepts well. Overall he's a great professor!

Dr. Logan is an easygoing prof and is a very good lecturer. However, the midterm included very specific questions that one would easily overlook or not study. I would suggest primarily using the textbook but the slides as a guide tool. Overall, the class is easy if you participate in discussions and put the work in.
The Course was easy. I echo the comments in the last review. Logan was straight to the point and messing around. Was there if you needed help. Simple course, easy to get a good grade.

This class by far was the easiest class I have taken at SFU. Logan is straight forward and likes work to be straight to the point. Make sure you have good writing skills and you will ace everything. Textbook was used and lectures are important along with not skipping any discussions. Midterm & final and paper were all easy! Just make sure you study
